body:
Can some one help build toxcore with clang, like libsodium do...

https://github.com/jedisct1/libsodium/commit/eaf19f25d0dff0f4e468629e6c5e0913e0642a5b

As i understand now ./configure edit some files to work only with gcc

P.S.
Can some one explain for me why i can't build without (i'm building with Android NDK)
--disable-rt \ (configure: error: required library rt was not found on your system)
--disable-testing \ (fatal error: pty.h: No such file or directory)

comment_data.body: what exactly is stopping you from building with clang? how did you try and what did not work?

Check that you have latest NDK r14

### Building libsodium:
Download https://github.com/jedisct1/libsodium/archive/master.zip and extract
- cd ~/Downloads/libsodium-master
- ./autogen.sh
- export ANDROID_NDK_HOME=~/Documents/android-sdk-macosx/ndk-bundle
- export NDK_PLATFORM="android-24" && export NDK_PLATFORM_COMPAT="android-16" && ./dist-build/android-arm.sh

**After build we have folders:**

- libsodium-android-armv6



### Building toxcore:
Download https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/archive/master.zip

- cd c-toxcore-master
- ./autogen.sh
- export ANDROID_NDK_HOME=~/Documents/android-sdk-macosx/ndk-bundle
- export SODIUM_HOME=~/Downloads/libsodium-master

Now interesting part. 
Edit **android-arm.sh**

```
#!/bin/sh
export TARGET_ARCH=armv6
export CFLAGS="-Os -mthumb -marm -march=${TARGET_ARCH}"
ARCH=arm HOST_COMPILER=arm-linux-androideabi "$(dirname "$0")/android-build.sh"
```

Edit **android-build.sh** (based on script from libsodium)

```
#! /bin/sh

if [ -z "$NDK_PLATFORM" ]; then
  export NDK_PLATFORM="android-24"
  export NDK_PLATFORM_COMPAT="${NDK_PLATFORM_COMPAT:-android-16}"
else
  export NDK_PLATFORM_COMPAT="${NDK_PLATFORM_COMPAT:-${NDK_PLATFORM}}"
fi
export NDK_API_VERSION=$(echo "$NDK_PLATFORM" | sed 's/^android-//')
export NDK_API_VERSION_COMPAT=$(echo "$NDK_PLATFORM_COMPAT" | sed 's/^android-//')

if [ -z "$ANDROID_NDK_HOME" ]; then
  echo "You should probably set ANDROID_NDK_HOME to the directory containing"
  echo "the Android NDK"
  exit
fi

if [ ! -f ./configure ]; then
  echo "Can't find ./configure. Wrong directory or haven't run autogen.sh?" >&2
  exit 1
fi

if [ "x$TARGET_ARCH" = 'x' ] || [ "x$ARCH" = 'x' ] || [ "x$HOST_COMPILER" = 'x' ]; then
  echo "You shouldn't use android-build.sh directly, use android-[arch].sh instead" >&2
  exit 1
fi

if [ -z "$SODIUM_HOME" ]; then
    echo "You should probably set SODIUM_HOME to the directory containing root sodium sources"
    exit
fi

export MAKE_TOOLCHAIN="${ANDROID_NDK_HOME}/build/tools/make_standalone_toolchain.py"

export PREFIX="$(pwd)/libsodium-android-${TARGET_ARCH}"
export TOOLCHAIN_DIR="$(pwd)/android-toolchain-${TARGET_ARCH}"
export PATH="${PATH}:${TOOLCHAIN_DIR}/bin"

export CC=${CC:-"${HOST_COMPILER}-clang"}

export MY_SYSROOT="${TOOLCHAIN_DIR}/sysroot"
export CFLAGS="${CFLAGS} --sysroot=${MY_SYSROOT} -I${MY_SYSROOT}/usr/include"
export CPPFLAGS="${CFLAGS}"
export LDFLAGS="${LDFLAGS} -L${MY_SYSROOT}/usr/lib"

# Clean up before build
rm -rf "${TOOLCHAIN_DIR}" "${PREFIX}"

echo
echo "Building for platform [${NDK_PLATFORM}], retaining compatibility with platform [${NDK_PLATFORM_COMPAT}]"
echo

env - PATH="$PATH" \
    "$MAKE_TOOLCHAIN" --force --api="$NDK_API_VERSION_COMPAT" \
    --unified-headers --arch="$ARCH" --install-dir="$TOOLCHAIN_DIR" || exit 1

#
# If i will build without this flags, i have errors
# --disable-rt \ (configure: error: required library rt was not found on your system)
# --disable-testing \ (fatal error: pty.h: No such file or directory)
#
./configure \
    --disable-soname-versions \
    --with-libsodium-headers="${SODIUM_HOME}/libsodium-android-${TARGET_ARCH}/include" \
    --with-libsodium-libs="${SODIUM_HOME}/libsodium-android-${TARGET_ARCH}/lib" \
    --disable-av \
    --disable-rt \
    --disable-testing \
    --host="${HOST_COMPILER}" \
    --prefix="${PREFIX}" \
    --with-sysroot="${TOOLCHAIN_DIR}/sysroot" || exit 1

if [ "$NDK_PLATFORM" != "$NDK_PLATFORM_COMPAT" ]; then
  egrep '^#define ' config.log | sort -u > config-def-compat.log
  echo
  echo "Configuring again for platform [${NDK_PLATFORM}]"
  echo
  env - PATH="$PATH" \
      "$MAKE_TOOLCHAIN" --force --api="$NDK_API_VERSION" \
      --unified-headers --arch="$ARCH" --install-dir="$TOOLCHAIN_DIR" || exit 1

#
# If i will build without this flags, i have errors
# --disable-rt \ (configure: error: required library rt was not found on your system)
# --disable-testing \ (fatal error: pty.h: No such file or directory)
#
  ./configure \
      --disable-soname-versions \
      --with-libsodium-headers="${SODIUM_HOME}/libsodium-android-${TARGET_ARCH}/include" \
      --with-libsodium-libs="${SODIUM_HOME}/libsodium-android-${TARGET_ARCH}/lib" \
      --disable-av \
      --disable-rt \
      --disable-testing \
      --host="${HOST_COMPILER}" \
      --prefix="${PREFIX}" \
      --with-sysroot="${TOOLCHAIN_DIR}/sysroot" || exit 1

  egrep '^#define ' config.log | sort -u > config-def.log
  if ! cmp config-def.log config-def-compat.log; then
    echo "Platform [${NDK_PLATFORM}] is not backwards-compatible with [${NDK_PLATFORM_COMPAT}]" >&2
    diff -u config-def.log config-def-compat.log >&2
    exit 1
  fi
  rm -f config-def.log config-def-compat.log
fi

make clean && \
make -j3 install && \
echo "libsodium has been installed into ${PREFIX}"
```

In log i see:
```
checking for LIBSODIUM... no
checking for crypto_pwhash_scryptsalsa208sha256 in -lsodium... no
configure: error: required library libsodium was not found in requested location ~/Downloads/libsodium-master/libsodium-android-armv6/lib or library version is too old
```

But library is there in this folder, i just build it.

My mistake...
Apparently something in the library, from master branch.
If i compile release version (https://github.com/jedisct1/libsodium/archive/1.0.11.zip) all OK.

But one more question, please.

Why i need this flags to compile for android(In brackets the error):
--disable-rt \ (configure: error: required library rt was not found on your system)
--disable-testing \ (fatal error: pty.h: No such file or directory)

Android is special, it already includes real-time extensions and you don't need to link against them. Not sure about `pty.h`.

This is how our build server builds toxcore for android, assuming you have all dependencies (sodium, opus, vpx) already cross-compiled to adnroid

```sh
mkdir prefix
cd prefix
PREFIX_DIR=$(pwd)
cd ..

mkdir toxcore
cd toxcore
tar -xvf ../libtoxcore-toktok_src.tar.xz
cd ..

if [[ ${JOB_NAME} == *"android"* ]]; then
    if [[ ${JOB_NAME} == *"armel"* ]]; then
        ARCH="arm"
        API="9"
        A_TOOLCHAIN="arm-linux-androideabi"
    elif [[ ${JOB_NAME} == *"arm64"* ]]; then
        ARCH="arm64"
        API="21"
        A_TOOLCHAIN="aarch64-linux-android"
    elif [[ ${JOB_NAME} == *"x86-64"* ]]; then
        ARCH="x86_64"
        API="21"
        A_TOOLCHAIN="x86_64-linux-android"
    elif [[ ${JOB_NAME} == *"x86"* ]]; then
        ARCH="x86"
        API="9"
        A_TOOLCHAIN="i686-linux-android"
    else
        echo "Error: Unsupported Android architecture!"
        exit 1
    fi

    export ANDROID_NDK_HOME=/opt/android-ndk
    mkdir toolchain
    cd toolchain
    export TOOLCHAIN=$(pwd)
    cd ..
    "$ANDROID_NDK_HOME/build/tools/make_standalone_toolchain.py" --arch ${ARCH} --api ${API} --install-dir "$TOOLCHAIN" --force
    export PATH="$TOOLCHAIN/bin:$PATH"

    mkdir dependency
    cd dependency
    DEPENDENCY_DIR=$(pwd)
    tar -xf ../libopus.tar.xz
    tar -xf ../libvpx.tar.xz
    tar -xf ../libsodium.tar.xz
    cd include
    cp opus/* ./
    cd ..
    cd ..
    
    cd toxcore
    sh ./autogen.sh
    sed -i 's|-lutil|-lm|g' testing/Makefile.inc
    ./configure --disable-epoll --host="$A_TOOLCHAIN" --prefix="$PREFIX_DIR" --disable-ntox --disable-tests --with-dependency-search="$DEPENDENCY_DIR" --disable-shared --enable-static --disable-rt
    echo "main() {}" > testing/tox_shell.c
    make
    make install

    cd ..

    cp ${DEPENDENCY_DIR}/* ${PREFIX_DIR} -R
fi

cd "${PREFIX_DIR}"
tar -cJf result.tar.xz *
```

@westman2000 what are you trying to do? i can't understand
we build for android on every commit:

https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/blob/master/circle.yml

https://circleci.com/gh/TokTok/c-toxcore/477

as soon as #488 ist merged, you can even download the artifacts

https://circleci.com/gh/zoff99/c-toxcore/183#artifacts

You already can download them from the build server:

- [arm](https://build.tox.chat/job/libtoxcore-toktok_build_android_armel_static_release/)
- [arm64](https://build.tox.chat/job/libtoxcore-toktok_build_android_arm64_static_release/)
- [x86](https://build.tox.chat/job/libtoxcore-toktok_build_android_x86_static_release/)
- [x86_64](https://build.tox.chat/job/libtoxcore-toktok_build_android_x86-64_static_release/)

It's nice to be able to build them on your own though, without relying on any CI or build sever artifacts.

rename.to: Build for android, with ndk r14
